title: 103_hr4290
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bosnia and Herzegovina Self-Defense Act of 1994". The Congress finds that the international arms embargo on Bosnia and Herzegovina violates their right to self-defense under international law. The United States should support Bosnia and Herzegovina's self-defense capabilities before deploying troops to defend or enforce UN mandates in the region. The arms embargo on Bosnia and Herzegovina is terminated. The President will end the US arms embargo on Bosnia and Herzegovina upon receiving a request for self-defense assistance under Article 51 of the UN Charter. The embargo refers to the policy in place since July 10, 1991, restricting defense transfers to Bosnia and Herzegovina. The US will end the arms embargo on Bosnia and Herzegovina, allowing defense transfers to the former Yugoslavia. The US will end the arms embargo on Bosnia and Herzegovina, allowing defense transfers to the former Yugoslavia. SEC. 4. PROVISION OF UNITED STATES MILITARY ASSISTANCE. The President should provide military assistance to Bosnia and Herzegovina upon request for self-defense under Article 51 of the UN Charter. The President is authorized to drawdown defense articles to provide assistance on determined terms. The President is authorized to provide military assistance to Bosnia and Herzegovina upon request for self-defense under Article 51 of the UN Charter. The value of defense articles, services, and training provided should not exceed $200,000,000. The authorization expires at the end of fiscal year 1995, and US Armed Forces members involved in such activities must not engage in combat duties. The President is authorized to provide military assistance to Bosnia and Herzegovina for self-defense. Reports to congress are required every sixty days on the defense articles, services, and training provided. Reimbursement for these services is not required except with appropriated funds. The President is authorized to provide military assistance to Bosnia and Herzegovina for self-defense. Reimbursement for defense articles, services, and training provided is authorized to be appropriated as necessary.
